hindu.text: Frugality is the sure guardian of our virtues.
If you ask the hungry man how much is two and two, he replies four loaves.
Dictators ride to and fro on tigers from which they dare not dismount.

There are hundreds of paths up the mountain, all leading to the same place, so it doesn’t matter which path you take. The only person wasting time is the one who runs around the mountain, telling everyone that his or her path is wrong
Help your brother’s boat across, and your own will reach the shore
No physician is really good before he has killed one or two patients
No sooner have you spoken than what you have said becomes the property of another.
Diet cures more than the surgical knife.
Regularity is the best medicine.
No one can be a totally fair judge in his own case.
Dig your well before you are thirsty.
In a treeless country, the castor plant is a big tree.
The living things of the Earth depend on each other just like the limbs and organs of the body.
An elephant, no matter how skinny, is valuable.
True nobility is in being superior to your previous self.
Give your ears to words but do not give your words to ears.
The adult looks to deeds, the child to love.
What is play to one is death to another.
When anger comes, wisdom goes.
A fool went to fish, but lost his fishing-basket.
A scalded cat dreads cold water.
A thief is a thief, whether he steals a diamond or a cucumber.
Call on God, but row away from the rocks.
Can your hands do what your tongue does?
Don't bargain for fish which are still in the water.
God gives food to every bird, but does not throw it into the nest.
God takes care of a blind cow.
He who will not climb will not fall.
I am king, you a king: who is to fetch the water?
In a treeless country, the castor-oil plant is a big tree.
Man is his own devil.
On a green tree there are many parrots.
One who cannot dance blames the floor.
Self Praise is no praise.
The eyes do not see what the mind does not want.
The washerman never tears his father's clothes.
When an elephant is in trouble even a frog will kick him.
Whose stick, his buffalo.
A man becomes like those whose society he loves.
A man in this world without learning is as a beast of the field.
Among the blind, the squint rules.
Anger has no eyes.
Can the monkey know the taste of ginger?
Can't tell his ass from a hole in the ground.
Dig a well every day to drink water every day.
Dig your well before you're thirsty.
Eating while seated makes one of large size; eating while standing makes one strong.
He who does kind deeds becomes rich.
Help thy brother's boat across, and lo! thine own has reached the shore.
Help your brother's boat across, and your own will reach the shore.
It is a cart if it travels well, else it is but timber.
It is better to walk than to run; it is better to stand than to walk; it is better to sit than to stand; it is better to lie than to sit.
Kill a cow to donate shoes.
Like the body that is made up of different limbs and organs, all mortal creatures exist depending upon one another.
Many dogs kill a hare, no matter how many turns it makes.
Of what use is the veil if you are going to dance.
Saints fly only in the eyes of their disciples.
Sleep after selling horses and elephants.
There is nothing noble in being superior to some other man. The true nobility is in being superior to your previous self.
These three take crooked ways: carts, boats, and musicians.
They who give have all things; they who withhold have nothing.
Those who give have all things; those who withhold have nothing.
To give quickly is a great virtue.
True happiness consists in making others happy.
Wash your hands in the flowing Ganges.
Bathe early every day and sickness will avoid you.
Dictators ride to and fro upon tigers which they dare not dismount.
Diet cures more than the lancet.
It is a cart if it goes well, otherwise it is but timber.
Once out of the throat it spreads over the world.
The adult looks to deed, the child to love.
The tree casts its shade upon all, even upon the woodcutter.
Waste makes want.
Waste not want not.
When a camel is at the foot of a mountain then judge of his height.
The young crow is wiser than its mother.
To lend is to buy a quarrel.
To lose is to learn.
Don’t bargain for fish which are still in the water.
The washerman never tears his father’s clothes.
Give cheerfully with one hand and you will gather well with two.
Help your brother’s boat across, and your own will reach the shore.
Even nectar is poison if taken to excess.
Help thy brother’s boat across, and lo! thine own has reached the shore.
No physician is really good before he has killed one or two patients.
When an elephant is in trouble even a frog will kick him.
Real happiness consists in making others happy.
Never strike your wife, even with a flower.
Dig your well before you’re thirsty.
Can’t tell his ass from a hole in the ground.
